metaData.title: Books and cosy spots at Casa Petri
metaData.description: After hiking or biking, relax by reading a book in the hammock. See here our books and cozy places from Casa Petri Rosia Montana.

specificArticles.textContent: All around the house you'll find books, newspapers and magazines, most of them inherited from our grandparents. We have drama, action, romance, children's, history, poetry and many others books. We also have newspapers and books about Rosia Montana. Unfortunately most of them are in romanian language. Please use them carefully and then leave them in the place where were found.

images.title: Suitcases with books
images.description: These suitcases were used to carry clothes in the army or jars with food when going to college, and now they are used for holding books, vinyls and Cinema magazines.

images.title: The door with books
images.description: If you like the smell of old books when you read, then this is your spot.

images.title: The cupboard with books
images.description: We decided to recycle this old, unused cupboard and transform it into a library. Here you can find a section with books for children.

specificArticles.textContent: After hiking or biking we invite you to relax in a cosy spot from our house or garden

images.title: Hammocks
images.description: In the yard we have some trees where we hang out hammocks. Here you can rest after a long hike and surf on the internet (there is wifi too).

images.title: The coffee table from 'târnaț'
images.description: 'Târnaț' is a hallway with small wooden windows specific to the houses from our area. Here is a where our grandparents used to have their morning coffee.

images.title: The terrace table
images.description: With a nice view to the 'Cârnic' mountain, it's the perfect spot for chatting, drinking 'țuica' or eat before going out for a hike

images.title: Living room
images.description: Here you can dine, hang out with your friends or play a board games. Have you ever played 'Saboteour' in a place with over 150 km of underground galleries? It may not be mountain climbing, but it is something to be tried..
